title: New Reckitt boss cuts sales guidance after 'disappointing' performance
text:
The new boss of Reckitt Benckiser has bemoaned the Durex and Nurofen owner’s “disappointing” performance and put a string of projects on hold as he battles to boost its fortunes.

Laxman Narasimhan, who took over from Rakesh Kapoor last month, said he will tackle the company’s problems “as a matter of urgency” after it was hit by weak sales of cold and flu medicine in the US and poor demand for baby products in China.

Sales increased just 1.6pc to £3.3bn during the three months to October, compared with market expectations of a 3.2pc rise.
